content: Also, I implemented some cleanup logic so that's the reason for all the closed PRs. From now on the bot will close PRs with more than one file. Repeats (against the same file path). And it will not open new PRs for paths with PRs already open

Some may be duplicates from earlier mentions, the bot went on a bit of a rampage and closed and then re-created a bunch of PRs.  ðŸ˜–  Figured since I was already doing the leg work of sifting through it all, I would let other editors know which EIPs they are tagged as an author on, rather than as an editor.

author: sky.cactus
content:
<@194432762315407360> What are your feelings about continuing to use the EIP process for gossip protocol changes?  It seems that historically we haven't used the EIP process effectively/correctly, and we now have several EIPs that are wasting away in a non-final state long after they have been implemented across many clients.  Unlike many other parts of Ethereum, the gossip protocol actually has regularly updated/maintained documents that I think you are the champion of.

Do you think we should just stop trying to use the EIP process for gossip changes and instead use the docs for change control?

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm bringing this up because https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2976 is still not final and I need to make a call on whether to move it to Last Call or Withdrawn, though there are a few EIPs in a similar state.

author: sky.cactus
content:
<https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/4187>
<https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/4188>
Can I get another editor to review the above two PRs?  They are for fairly old EIPs of mine, so I'm sure are full of things I would normally block EIPs on, so now is your opportunity to get payback!

author: .fjl
content: Re. networking EIPs: I think there is value in at least announcing networking changes through EIPs. I think the process for core changes is too complicated for networking because the number of people involved in these topics is very small.

author: sky.cactus
content: The EIP process isn't designed to be used for announcements.  If the process doesn't fit, I think we just shouldn't use it.
